title: Hallett Peak
text:
Hallett Peak is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> <a href="summit">summit</a> in the northern <a href="Front%20Range">Front Range</a> of the <a href="Rocky%20Mountains">Rocky Mountains</a> of <a href="North%20America">North America</a>. The peak is located in the <a href="Rocky%20Mountain%20National%20Park%20Wilderness">Rocky Mountain National Park Wilderness</a>, southwest by west (<a href="Absolute%20bearing">bearing</a> 240°) of the <a href="Estes%20Park%2C%20Colorado">Town of Estes Park</a>, <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, on the <a href="Continental%20Divide%20of%20the%20Americas">Continental Divide</a> between <a href="Grand%20County%2C%20Colorado">Grand</a> and <a href="Larimer%20County%2C%20Colorado">Larimer counties</a>.
Mountain.
Hallett Peak is on the Continental Divide, flanked by Flattop Mountain to the north and <a href="Otis%20Peak">Otis Peak</a> to the south. Just to its east lie <a href="Emerald%20Lake%20%28Rocky%20Mountain%20National%20Park%29">Emerald Lake</a>, <a href="Dream%20Lake">Dream Lake</a>, and <a href="Nymph%20Lake">Nymph Lake</a>, which are usually accessed from the <a href="Bear%20Lake%20Comfort%20Station">Bear Lake Comfort Station</a>. 
The "<a href="Northcutt-Carter%20Route%20%28Hallett%20Peak%29">Northcutt-Carter Route</a>" of Hallett Peak is recognized in the historic climbing text "<a href="Fifty%20Classic%20Climbs%20of%20North%20America">Fifty Classic Climbs of North America</a>". Non-technical climbers may reach the summit of Hallett Peak by hiking up the Flattop Mountain Trail to its highpoint, then walking south along the ridgeline and ascending the peak over talus piles.
